title: (28012) Madrid - 54 Calle de Atocha

title: (28012) Madrid - 2 Calle de Miguel Servet

title: (28005) Madrid - 26 Paseo Ciudad de Plasencia
description: Area in orange and blue lines. No height and length limit between two parks. Cars can park up to 12 hours and the maximum rate is six euros.

title: (28008) Madrid - 1 Calle Profesor Martín Almagro Basch
title_short: (28008) Madrid - 1 Calle Profesor Martín Almagro Basch

title: (28008) Madrid - 2 Calle de Francisco y Jacinto Alcántara
title_short: (28008) Madrid - 2 Calle de Francisco y Jacinto Alcántara
description: Car parking on which it is possible to park motorhomes (even 7.5m like ours). you still have to be lucky to find a place. parking free from Saturday 3 p.m. parking near the heart of Madrid. 10min from Plaza de España or the Royal Palace. Municipal police building just under the parking lot, reassuring.

address.street: 2 Calle de Francisco y Jacinto Alcántara

title: (28008) Madrid - Paseo de Camoens

title: (28011) Madrid - 6 Paseo del Embarcadero
description: Public parking without the possibility to stay overnight.

title: (28007) Madrid - 47 Calle de Juan de Urbieta
title_short: (28007) Madrid - 47 Calle de Juan de Urbieta
description: Good place and very close to the Retiro Park, the center, the subway station, etc ... We have only been one night, there were people passing by and some cars with which the place was somewhat safer, to visit Christmas is great . ps: it is a blue zone but we do not pay when you come on weekends and holidays

title: (28011) Madrid - Pl. de las Moreras
description: In Casa de Campo in Madrid, before one of the exits of the M30. It is a wide roundabout with spaces for about 30 vehicles. Very quiet and there is a fountain

title: (28040) Madrid - 1 Travesía Antonio Nebrija
description: Parking by the park, about 10 minutes walk from the metro station, loud from cars, busy to find a place but no ticket as well to park a bit further down by the bus stop and others park there as well

title: (28011) Madrid - Paseo de la Puerta del Ángel
title_short: (28011) Madrid - Paseo de la Puerta del Ángel

title: (28011) Madrid - 7 Calle Ferial
description: Free parking day and night, lots of light, near Casa de Campo. Much less "nocturnal" activities. We arrived at 8pm and it's almost full. There are all kinds of vehicles, we have a motorhome and we found a good place.

title: (28011) Madrid - 108 Paseo de Extremadura
description: Laundromat, with laundry and softener included. Machines with coins.

title: (28011) Madrid - 14 Paseo Puerta del Ángel

title: (28011) Madrid - 17 Calle Principal Dlas Provincias
description: Parking of an abandoned restaurant, there is no height limit or time zone. Very large sites

title: (28047) Madrid - 2 Calle de Pablo Sarasate
description: We have slept on this street without problems, and without noise one night. There are no motorhome prohibition signs, and we are a 40-minute walk from the center of Madrid.

title: (28008) Madrid -
description: Paid but free flat parking from Saturday 3 p.m. to Monday 8 a.m.

title: (28011) Madrid - C. Maria del Carmen
description: Street parking area where we have left our car, and we have had no problems sleeping. The only drawback is that it is a bus stop area, because there is a stop right in front of it, but we even left our bikes in the bike rack for a full day and night, while we walked around Madrid, and they were not stolen. I want to think that it was not by chance, but because this falls within what should be normal

title: (28011) Madrid - Paseo Puerta del Angel S/N
title_short: (28011) Madrid - Paseo Puerta del Angel S/N
description: Parking of the fairground of the Casa de Campo. It is frequented by motorhomes and vans, it is a quiet place to spend the night and close to the metro. The downtown is 15 minutes walking.

title: (28045) Madrid - 5 Calle Estrella Denébola
description: Public parking with blue zone, 4h 8.20e, at night without payment.

title: (28047) Madrid -

title: (28011) Madrid - 4 Ronda Lago
description: Parking between a railway line and Ronda Lago. The only one where there was room.

title: (28045) Madrid - 13 Calle Villarrobledo
description: Quiet and central location, bus, metro and train very close, next to the municipal police.

title: (28002) Madrid - 165 Calle de Serrano

title: (28028) Madrid - 79 Avenida Toreros
description: Next to the Plaza de Toros de Las Ventas. Urban transport and the city nearby. Parking closed on bullfighting days.

title: (28019) Madrid - 54 Calle Comandante Fontanes
description: Quite and free parking, no heigh limit, ground is sand and pretty flat. Next to a big park where its nice to have breakfast. Also very close to the metro. Neighborhood is really nice and friendly.

title: (28028) Madrid - 3 Calle de Roberto Domingo
description: Blue zone parking, from 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m., Saturdays and Sundays free. In August until 15:00 the blue zone. Next to the Las Ventas bullring. Many parking lots and easy entrance, although there is an uneven area.

title: (28011) Madrid - 2 Ronda Toros
description: Large parking lot as a stopgap when "Casa do Campo" is crowded. 40 mins walk from Madrid.

title: (28053) Madrid - 3 Calle del Monte Perdido

If you have a gym basic fit there is one and you can shower

title: (28019) Madrid -

A fountain is located 5 minutes from the other side of the road (behind the attraction park), left of the small stream.

title: (28040) Madrid -

description: Self-service laundry 3 washing machines, two dryers and washing station for pet clothes/blankets

title: (28011) Madrid - 3 Carretera Teleférico
description: Valuable place to visit Madrid. attached to the cycle path and in the middle of the park. Cable car that takes you downtown and restaurants and activities within walking distance. water fountain and dirt bins. at night the parking lot is completely illuminated and empty. recommended

title: (28011) Madrid - Carr. del Parque de Atracciones
title_short: (28011) Madrid - Carr. del Parque de Atracciones
description: Parking right next to the amusement park, outside the area where daytime parking is only allowed. There are more users who spend the night to go to the park, which gives security. The area is flat and wide with trees.

title: (28047) Madrid - Av. de Angel Sanz Briz
title_short: (28047) Madrid - Av. de Angel Sanz Briz
description: Free parking next to the metro, from there 20 minutes by metro into the city.

title: (28041) Madrid - 34 Calle de González Feito
description: Good place to stay 4 the night. Just the closest spot to M30 inner circle and proper place if going to a festival in the Enrique Tierno Galván Park (i.e. tomavistas). just an urban place to park during the day and stay at night, for free in Madrid (which is not easy).

title: (28020) Madrid - 20 Calle del General Margallo
description: Great laundry. The owner, Roberto, available on the mobile for any questions or concerns. Very nice. He is also president of the Tetuán triathlon club. All your information on map.

title: (28038) Madrid - 10 Calle de Ramón Pérez de Ayala
title_short: (28038) Madrid - 10 Calle de Ramón Pérez de Ayala
description:
In this street there are usually large parking spaces next to Parque de las Tetas (Cerro del Tio Pio), from where you have magnificent views of Madrid and the sunset. It has no shade and is not flat.
There is a free public toilet next door.
There are also several fountains, one of them in the children's area next to the viewpoint bar, although there are several more throughout the park. Next to it there are also some calisthenics bars to exercise.
It is in the Vallecas neighborhood, so relatively close you can find all kinds of establishments. It is about a 15-minute walk from the Nueva Numancia metro, which in 10 more minutes leaves you in the center of Madrid.

address.street: 10 Calle de Ramón Pérez de Ayala

title: (28040) Madrid - 1 Carretera de la Dehesa de la Villa
title_short: (28040) Madrid - 1 Carretera de la Dehesa de la Villa

title: (28038) Madrid - s/n Calle de Ramón Pérez de Ayala

title_short: (28017) Madrid - Avenida de las Trece Rosas
description: Large car park of the Almudena cemetery, no services, to visit Madrid.

title: (28011) Madrid - P.º de la Venta
description: Free off-road parking inside a park. 500 m from the metro. We arrived at 8pm and the parking space was almost free. No service.

title: (28026) Madrid - 83 Avenida de Rafaela Ybarra

Also, not far away there is a gas station also with restrooms and a store, I don't know if they have more services but it's a question of asking? Nearby you have public transport to get to the city center if you are visiting (bus 60, 6, 78, 81 and metro Plaza Elíptica lines 6 and 11)

title: (28011) Madrid - Unnamed Road
description: Parking limited to the hours of the zoo. Looking a little, you will find places where the ac is perfectly parked. perfect for visiting the zoo.

title: (28033) Madrid - 4 Calle de Julia Balenchana

There are no houses on the street, just some kind of convent and the street is practically dead. down the street and to the right there is a fountain. down the street and across there is a park. more or less nearby there are some shops

title: (28030) Madrid - 66 Calle Jose Bergamín
description: It is a park that you can see that the works have been finished very recently and they are just putting up trees, we have spent 2 very quiet nights. some motorhomes staying overnight but the stalls are small so the motorhomes I have seen parked were occupying 3 stalls. It is a dirt car park with very little unevenness. good for fall - winter - spring, no big trees yet and no cover from the sun. being from land there is a lot of dust and having the windows open is a disaster

description: Free parking in front of a park and near a crossroads.

title: (28035) Madrid - 5 Calle de Cándido Mateos
description: Next to the soccer field, near the Antonio Machado subway to hear downtown. Quiet area, there is noise when they play football but at night it is quiet to sleep. there are always motorhomes parked.

title: (28041) Madrid - 275 Calle Segura
description: Parking in a very quiet area without traffic, a few meters away there is a push-button fountain where water can be loaded. It has a very large park and some shadows.

description: Fuente de pulsador

title: (28053) Madrid - 231 Ronda del Sur
description: Parking is prohibited on Sundays and holidays from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. per market, normally empty esplanade ideal for spending the night in front of the linear park of entrevias

title: (28041) Madrid - 24 Calle Campotéjar
description: Car park at the Orcasitas commuter train station, free and with direct access to the commuter train three stops from the city center (Sol station). Perfect to leave the car in the outskirts and go visit the city. Enough space for motorhome

title: (28040) Madrid - 7 Avenida Padre Huidobro
description: Parking by the pool, very nice. Motorway next to the car park.

title: (28053) Madrid -
description: Parking in the train of the well little traveled, admits any vehicle is quiet if you would sleep here

title: (28046) Madrid - 2A Calle Tulipan
description: Free gravel parking used by locals. It's a little hard to find the right entry. It seems unregulated but everybody uses it and you won't get a ticket. The entry roads are VERY bumpy with lots of potholes, it gets better inside the parking and it's worth it, you won't find a free parking as well situated in Madrid. It's very close to one of the main train stations (CHAMARTIN) and bus stations (PLAZA DE CASTILLA) and there are bars and supermarkets all around. It's also unusually silent for it's location appart from the rush hours where people parks in our out to go to work/home. I asked around and everybody said that it was a very safe place to park as well.

title: (28024) Madrid - 111 Calle de Escalona
description: Automatic laundry with extensive opening hours 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. and with a washing machine of up to 21 kg, and large dryers of 21 kg next to the N-5. no parking problems or payment area.

title: (28027) Madrid - 55C Calle Miami
description: Very quiet and safe road to leave the motorhome and visit Madrid. It parks very well outside office hours. It is an area of ​​upscale family homes. Connected to a beautiful park "Quinta de los Molinos". Very famous for its almond trees in bloom at the beginning of spring. Flat and wide street for parking. Metro very close.

title: (28041) Madrid - 1 Avenida de Andalucía
description: Exterior parking of the Carrefour supermarket, quiet and safe. Everything went well. Calm and quiet place.

title: (28044) Madrid - 62 Avenida de los Poblados
description: Free parking for Park&Ride. It’s a 15 minutes metro trip from the city centre. I don’t really know how it is spending the night there, though

title: (28053) Madrid - 103 Calle Reguera de Tomateros
description:
Large paved but very simple parking lot without limited signage in the immediate vicinity of various sports facilities. 300 m from El Pozo train station and from there suburban trains to Madrid Atocha train station.
Shade morning or afternoon depending on location.

title: (28037) Madrid - 8B Calle Juan de Arespacochaga y Felipe
title_short: (28037) Madrid - 8B Calle Juan de Arespacochaga y Felipe

title: (28031) Madrid - 81 Calle de Luis I

title: (28046) Madrid - 300 Paseo de la Castellana

There is a market nearby, as well as bakeries, bars and other services. There are good views of the four towers but it is a bit noisy area being close to the Castellana.

title: (28044) Madrid - 3 Camino de las Cruces
description: Spacious parking. Monday market

title: (28043) Madrid - 71 Calle de Silvano
description: Parking all kinds of vehicles ... day and night ... we slept only 1 night, since we were on our way to visit some friends ... but you can stay more nights. prohibited on Tuesdays that there is a market. title: (28032) Madrid - Autovía del Este

description:
Public parking.
3 portable toilets and bins.
Quiet site and frequented peak, very quiet.

title: (28022) Madrid - 19 Calle Alonso de Contreras
description: Quiet parking in summer, holidays and weekends. Small forest and park.

title: (28034) Madrid - 24 Calle Sangenjo

title_short: (28223) Pozuelo de Alarcón - 7 Calle del Doctor Raso

title: (28051) Las Cigüeñas

title: (28032) Madrid - Blvr. de Jose Prat
description: We discovered this place through a blog. It is free and you can stay overnight. Apparently there are always motorhomes parked here. We spent one night and everything was fine. Safe. It has a shopping center in front and the neighborhood is quiet with large parks.

title: (28037) Madrid - 107 Avenida de Guadalajara

title: (28033) Madrid - 38 Calle Santa Adela
description: Very large parking. Metro 5 min walk. No parking problems, I have a motorhome and live in front. The only thing on Sundays you can not park by market. You can also park in front.

title: (28032) Madrid - 5 Avenida Comunidades

title: (28035) Madrid - 37 Calle Valle de Enmedio
description: Free 10 minutes from the metro to go downtown with one change. Residential area.

title: (28043) Madrid - 10 Calle Dionisio Inca Yupanqui
description: There is plenty of parking on this street. We park without problems to go to Mad Cool IFEMA, during the day they park more vehicles.

title: (28024) Madrid - 57 Calle Fuente del Tiro
description: Streets with free parking area to leave the van and take the Spanish Aviation metro, which takes you directly to the center of Madrid. We found it to be a quiet area to park all day, we had no problems

title: (28034) Madrid - 10 Calle Condestables
description:
A free and fairly quiet car park both during the day and at night.

A 10 minute walk from a metro stop. And by bike 10 minutes from the Castellana.

Highly recommended for old or unlabeled campers, since they cannot enter the m30 and interior of Madrid, due to the environment.

There are no parking lots so close and free around the city.

The only drawback is that it has quite a few holes in the ground, be careful with the bass, although going slow is no problem.

title: (28035) Madrid - 155 Calle Valle de Enmedio
description: Quiet, next to a police station with two subway lines nearby, fountain. Ideal for visiting the city.

title: (28050) Madrid - 11 Calle del Arroyo de Valdebebas
title_short: (28050) Madrid - 11 Calle del Arroyo de Valdebebas
description: Perfect place to sleep, a little noise from cars, but the truth is that very quiet, 50 meters from a bus stop, we were 3 days without problems of any kind, quite flat in some parking spaces.

title: (28042) Madrid - 8 Calle Amberes

Quiet zone. With quick exit to the M40. It is a great residential area. Good Bar Restaurant on the terrace of the station.

title: (28042) Madrid - 51 Avenida de Logroño

title_short: (28055) Madrid - 8 Avenida de las Fuerzas Armadas

title_short: (28031) Madrid - 31 Calle Muela de San Juan

name: Camping Osuna
title: (28042) Camping Osuna
description:
Nuevo Camping Osuna, next to El Capricho Park is the only campsite in the city of Madrid. Ideal for visiting the city, a 7-minute walk from the Madrid metro, with a direct line to Gran Via (25min). Open all year long. Emptying of black and gray water only for lodged clients. Bakery, minimarket, cafeteria, Wi-Fi room...etc.
Food trucks, music and a pleasant nightlife.

title: (28055) Madrid - Av. de las Fuerzas Armadas
title_short: (28055) Madrid - Av. de las Fuerzas Armadas
description: Parking very close to Ifema, perfect for the Mad Cool Festival (5 to 10 min walk from the entrance). A few trees create shade, and a large public park is a 2-minute walk away with very clean toilets open during the day (go to the second brown hut, the 1st is a technical room). There is something to walk around and games for children. Tap with drinking water. Despite the festival, we were only a few Vans and CCs on this huge parking lot, so all very well-off and spaced out. For light sleepers, bring earplugs for the return walk of festival-goers, but the road is closed to traffic so perfect for the night.

title: (28916) Leganés - Avenida de Gran Bretaña
description: Norauto car park in Commercial Centre Parquesur, many places, I had to stay there because of a breakdown. In the morning I saw other van on the commercial centre car park. Free wifi and toilets in the commercial centre. a bit noisy

title: (28048) Madrid - 48 Carretera Madrid-El Pardo

Flight and airport personnel park there. There is therefore constant movement and police rounds. *** no parking Friday evening-late Saturday evening it is market day ***

Good for visiting Madrid, although we have not stayed overnight, it seems like a quiet and safe place. Public toilets at the train station when it is open. There is a large park next door with picnic areas, ping pong tables and swings for children

title: (28904) Getafe - 26 Avenida Reyes Catolicos

title: (28523) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 2T Calle Pamplona
description: Big parking lot all along the road right next to the metro station. Day and night allowed. We slept for one night without a problem and left our van in the day to go into Madrid. Parking spaces are about average length. We could fit our 6 meter van in a space. Might struggle if you’re longer.

There is no lighting.
